facts: Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not technically berries.
Humans share about 50% of their DNA with bananas.
Bananas float in water because they're less dense than water.
The inside of a banana peel can soothe mosquito bites and minor burns.
Bananas are naturally radioactive due to their potassium content.
One banana plant can produce up to 200 bananas in a single harvest.
Bananas grow pointing upward toward the sun, not hanging down.
The scientific name for banana is Musa sapientum, meaning 'fruit of the wise men'.
Bananas were one of the first fruits cultivated by humans over 7,000 years ago.
There are over 1,000 different varieties of bananas in the world.
Bananas contain tryptophan which converts to serotonin, helping improve mood.
The world's largest exporter of bananas is Ecuador, not a Caribbean nation.
Bananas don't grow on trees - they grow on large herbaceous plants.
Rubbing the inside of a banana peel on your teeth can help whiten them.
The Cavendish banana we eat today could go extinct due to a fungal disease.
Bananas ripen faster when placed in a brown paper bag.
Uganda has the highest per-capita banana consumption in the world at 500 pounds per year.
